revised_title: The Relation of Urea to Total Nitrogen in Urine in Disease
tldr: This article investigates the relationship between urea and total nitrogen in urine in various diseases. The author finds that in most cases, urea accounts for around 90% of the total nitrogen in urine, which is consistent with healthy individuals. The study emphasizes the importance of considering individual variations and the need for more research on the subject.
scientific_discipline: Medicine and Health Sciences > Medical Chemistry
